subject: Sexual Health
title: Mutual Monogamy and Risk
description: A micro-lesson that makes Mutual Monogamy and Risk usable.

hook.text: Being in a committed relationship reduces STI risk, but only under certain conditions.

buildup.text: Mutual monogamy means both partners have sex only with each other after confirmed negative tests.

discovery.text: The key word is mutual. If only one partner is faithful, STI risk remains unchanged for the other.

twist.text: Studies show many people assume monogamy without ever discussing or verifying it with their partner.

climax.text: Open communication and joint testing are what actually make monogamy a reliable prevention strategy.

punchline.text: Trust matters, but testing confirms it.

quiz.question: What makes mutual monogamy effective for STI prevention?
